snippet: The director of the library, Natalia Sharina, was placed under house arrest and could face as much as five years in prison.
abstract: Russian authorities place Natalia Sharina, director of Ukrainian-language library in Moscow, under house arrest for allegedly allowing public access to banned books by Ukrainian nationalist writer Dmytro Korchynsky.
lead_paragraph: The director of the library, Natalia Sharina, was placed under house arrest and could face as much as five years in prison.

headline.main: Russia: Librarian Is Accused of Allowing Access to Banned Ukrainian Books
headline.print_headline: Europe; Russia: Librarian Is Accused of Allowing Access to Banned Ukrainian Books
